intro: Amsinckia eatonii, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb characterized by its hairy, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. Amsinckia eatonii is adapted to arid environments, with deep roots that help it survive in dry conditions. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is an important species for pollinators in its native range.
